chapter.title: Skit Policies
chapter.para: This will describe various development policies within skit. In particular, the intent with regard to generated DDL, the strange use of make and the Makefile hierarchy, coding standards, etc. The intent is that this is not an onerous, prescriptive section, but rather one that explains where the developers are coming from.

section.title: Why the GPL?
section.para: The choice of licence for a project can be contentious. It is not an easy choice.

The GPL was chosen for a number of reasons, all seriously considered. Marc believes that Free Software is important, and that the GPL best ensures the freedom of the users of that software. Although other licenses may be more liberal, by explictly allowing commercialisation of the software, doing so takes away the freedom to use derivative works from the world at large. It grants a freedom to a small self-interested group, at the expense of the larger community.
You may disagree with this belief, but please respect the choice of license that has been made. Skit represents many hundreds of man hours of development and is being freely given to the community.

section.title: But I want to incorporate skit into XXXX
section.para: If you want a commercial license, please get in touch with Marc. If it is for a product derived from PostgreSQL you will find a sympathetic ear, and a willingness to help.
